The game to raise online privacy awareness and knowledge for parents



Dear Participants,


This game survey is a mimic interface of social media platform, aim at raising awareness and knowledge for parents, guardians, family members who have minors (including expected baby and children aged 0-17) in your family. This study will be a part of the Thesis research for M.S. in computer science at Kent State University, topic : Children's Online Privacy from Parents' Perspective. IRB approval Level-1, Social & Behavioral Research.


Any personal information will not be recorded or used, only the post-survey. Your information is completely anonymous and secured. You will receive the score card at the end of the game to see your performance , then you will be asked to provide feedback in the post-survey after that (link provided in the score card page). The game contains 5 steps and a post- survey has 9 questions, estimated time to complete this task is 3-10 minutes.


Any further question, please contact Paweena Manotipya (pmanotip@kent.edu)


Thank you very much for your participation.

Instruction

How to Play


Social Sim Parents is a simple game with simple rules. It is similar to your social network site. Your challenges are to choose a photo and post as you see fit. To win the game, you simply finish step 1-5 of each scenario. You can choose one photo at a time according to the given scenario and see your final scores.

  • You have to "sign-up" to start the game, and login with your signed email and password
  • You have to remember your USER #, and provide Mturks ID at the end of the survey
    (link to the survey is provided at the end of step-5)

NOTE: Your information is anonymous and will not be collected or used outside of this platform.
